attachments.text:
I've just wrapped up the initial implementation of our authentication workflow, along with some foundational user account management features. Here's what's new:

*Features:*

• *Login, Signup, & OTP Verification*: We now have fully functional forms for user authentication. Whether it's a new user signing up or an existing one logging in, we've got it covered. Plus, OTP verification for that extra layer of security.
• *Account Management*: Users can now peek into their account details and even opt to delete their account if they wish.
• *UI Enhancements*: Introduced a bunch of new components (Alerts, Buttons, Dialogs) and extended input functionalities (OTP, Select) to enrich our UI toolkit.
• *Layout Improvements*: The layout got a bit of a facelift too, with a specific focus on authentication flows and overall site structure.
• *Secure Navigation*: Added Public and Protected routes to ensure pages are accessed as intended based on the user's auth state.
• *Under the Hood*: Made updates to global CSS for better autofill styles, tweaked our store for authentication state management, and sprinkled in some utility functions for good measure.

*Next Steps:*

This lays the groundwork for our upcoming features. With authentication out of the way, we can focus on building out the rest of the user-centric views and functionalities.
attachments.title: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify-frontend/pull/3|#3 Feature/authentication>
